full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 171 of 262 1882 LC8VMAX6 Rodgers - cross 1 A. No. 2 Q. All right. Now, you did testify that when you flew the planes, both the Gulfstream and the Boeing, the cockpit doors were closed? 3 4 A. Correct. 5 6 Q. And so if they are closed, you can't necessarily see what's happening in the passenger section of the plane; is that right? 7 8 A. That's right. 9 Q. Okay. But you were never instructed by Jeffrey Epstein or anyone else, for that matter, that you were not allowed to ever leave the cockpit during flight, were you? 10 11 A. No. 12 13 Q. He never told you, for example, You have to stay in the cockpit; you cannot leave, David Rodgers? 14 15 A. No, he never said that. 16 Q. Okay. And he never told you and nor did anybody else that you could never mingle with the passengers on the flight, did he? 17 18 A. That he could never what? 19 20 Q. That you could never mingle or meet the passengers on the flight? 21 22 A. No. 23 THE COURT: If we could just make sure the question finishes before the answers. 24 25 MR. EVERDELL: I'm sorry. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013449

1 A. No. 2 Q. All right. Now, you did testify that when you flew the planes, both the Gulfstream and the Boeing, the cockpit doors were closed? 3 4 A. Correct. 5 6 Q. And so if they are closed, you can't necessarily see what's happening in the passenger section of the plane; is that right? 7 8 A. That's right. 9 Q. Okay. But you were never instructed by Jeffrey Epstein or anyone else, for that matter, that you were not allowed to ever leave the cockpit during flight, were you? 10 11 A. No. 12 13 Q. He never told you, for example, You have to stay in the cockpit; you cannot leave, David Rodgers? 14 15 A. No, he never said that. 16 Q. Okay. And he never told you and nor did anybody else that you could never mingle with the passengers on the flight, did he? 17 18 A. That he could never what? 19 20 Q. That you could never mingle or meet the passengers on the flight? 21 22 A. No. 23 THE COURT: If we could just make sure the question finishes before the answers. 24 25 MR. EVERDELL: I'm sorry.
